question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
Find the average value of $\displaystyle \sin(x)$ on the interval
$\displaystyle [0,\pi]$.
sols:
Here $a=0$, $b=\pi$ and $f(x) = \sin x.$ Thus

\begin{align*} f_{av} &= \frac1{\pi-0} \int_0^\pi \sin x\,dx \\
&= \frac1{\pi} \left.(-\cos x)\right|_0^\pi \\
&= \frac1{\pi} (-\cos \pi + \cos 0) \\
&= \frac2{\pi}.
\end{align*}
hints:
The average value of a function on the interval $\displaystyle [a,b]$ is

$f_{av} = \frac1{b-a} \int_a^b f(x)\,dx.$
